ArticleTitle.sentence: Dual regulation of inaA by the multiple antibiotic resistance (mar) and superoxide (soxRS) stress response systems of Escherichia coli.

event.clue: Dual regulation of inaA by the multiple antibiotic resistance (mar) and superoxide (soxRS) stress response systems of Escherichia coli.

AbstractText.sentence: The roles of the marRAB (multiple antibiotic resistance) operon and soxRS (superoxide response) genes in the regulation of inaA, an unlinked weak-acid-inducible gene, were studied.

event.clue: The roles of the marRAB (multiple antibiotic resistance) operon and soxRS (superoxide response) genes in the regulation of inaA, an unlinked weak-acid-inducible gene, were studied.

AbstractText.sentence: inaA expression was estimated from the beta-galactosidase activity of a chromosomal inaA1::lacZ transcriptional fusion.

event.clue: inaA expression was estimated from the beta-galactosidase activity of a chromosomal inaA1::lacZ transcriptional fusion.

AbstractText.sentence: marR mutations that elevate marRAB transcription and engender multiple antibiotic resistance elevated inaA expression by 10- to 20-fold over that of the wild-type.

event.clue: marR mutations that elevate marRAB transcription and engender multiple antibiotic resistance elevated inaA expression by 10- to 20-fold over that of the wild-type.
marR mutations that elevate marRAB transcription and engender multiple antibiotic resistance elevated inaA expression by 10- to 20-fold over that of the wild-type.

marR mutations that elevate marRAB transcription and engender multiple antibiotic resistance elevated inaA expression by 10- to 20-fold over that of the wild-type.

AbstractText.sentence: Similarly, one class of inaA constitutive mutants that mapped to the mar region were multiply antibiotic resistant.
Overexpression of marA alone on a multicopy plasmid caused high constitutive expression of inaA in a strain with an extensive (39-kbp) marRAB deletion.

event.clue: Overexpression of marA alone on a multicopy plasmid caused high constitutive expression of inaA in a strain with an extensive (39-kbp) marRAB deletion.
Overexpression of marA alone on a multicopy plasmid caused high constitutive expression of inaA in a strain with an extensive (39-kbp) marRAB deletion.

AbstractText.sentence: Salicylate, an inducer of marRAB and of an unidentified mar-independent antibiotic resistance system, induced inaA by 6-fold.

event.clue: Salicylate, an inducer of marRAB and of an unidentified mar-independent antibiotic resistance system, induced inaA by 6-fold.

AbstractText.sentence: A portion of this induction was also mar independent.
Two soxRS constitutive mutants that were tested showed elevated levels of inaA.

event.clue: Two soxRS constitutive mutants that were tested showed elevated levels of inaA.

AbstractText.sentence: Paraquat, an inducer of the soxRS system, elevated inaA expression by 6- to 9-fold.

event.clue: Paraquat, an inducer of the soxRS system, elevated inaA expression by 6- to 9-fold.
Paraquat, an inducer of the soxRS system, elevated inaA expression by 6- to 9-fold.

AbstractText.sentence: This induction was soxRS dependent and not mar dependent, whereas induction of inaA by salicylate was not dependent on soxRS.

event.clue: This induction was soxRS dependent and not mar dependent, whereas induction of inaA by salicylate was not dependent on soxRS.

AbstractText.sentence: Paraquat induced resistance to norfloxacin in the mar-deleted strain but not in a soxRS-deleted strain.
Thus, induction of multiple antibiotic resistance and inaA by salicylate occurs via mar and an unidentified pathway, while induction by paraquat occurs via soxRS.

event.clue: Thus, induction of multiple antibiotic resistance and inaA by salicylate occurs via mar and an unidentified pathway, while induction by paraquat occurs via soxRS.
